page.title: 11KINGSTON SEYMOUR
page.content: Kingston Seymour is a small village north-west of Yatton.It is a marshland village, very low-lying.It has been flooded several times. The last time was in December,1981. New ditches have been dug to stop it happening again. The houses in the village are a mixture of old and new. The old houses were mostly farmhouses. There is only one shop in Kingston which sells general groceries. There isn't a pub but there is a village hall. The Old school has been made into a place where people can learn to spin and weave wool. It is run by Mrs Kingcott,a farmer's wife .She also has some Jacobs sheep to spin the fleece into wool. These sheep have patches of brown and white wool.
